data.title: Sushi heaven
data.text: We really enjoy this spot and almost always sit at the sushi bar! They also have the teppanyaki that is fun too but we do not come for the show we come for the sushi! We always get the sashimi deluxe for 2 and it NEVER disappoints! Beautiful presentation of super fresh fish and super appetizers in little martini glasses. We also get rolls from time to time but quite honestly the sashimi is so huge it's more than enough! Great place and we visit monthly. Well worth a visit if you are in the area!

data.title: I rather drive to Benihana
data.text: Japan is seems dirty. It is obvious that they have not invested money into the place for a while. Quality of the food is not the best. I would not recommend this restaurant, you are better of driving to Benihana.

data.title: Hibachi
data.text: Was a cool place to go with the family! Cozy, and make us interact when they are cooking the hibachi, my son love it!, the miso soup is here is the best ever!!

data.title: Pleasant enough
data.text: Not the smartest place in town,  but a fun way to be served a reasonably tasty meal. All meals seem to start with a clear soup and a salad doused in a liquid fish salad dressing, neither of which are that good, but the Chinese style egg fried rice, noodles and veg were tasty. We had ours with Steak, shrimp and chicken, all of which were good quality.

data.title: Loved the place, drinks and food
data.text: This was an awesome place with great cocktails. The hibachi style food was mouthwatering and very awesome. Even the kids did not have a problem gobbling down the food. Good ambience. Not sure if it was our luck, even with reservation we waited for 30 mins to be seated. It was not crowded but not sure why we had to wait.

data.title: OMG
data.text:
Friends had been telling me how good Japan Inn was, and last night they took me there for dinner. And, wow, did I enjoy every morsel.
I ordered the steak and lobster, and I'm sooooo glad I did.
While at first the price seemed a little steep, once I saw the size of the steak and lobster tail, I knew the price was right on the money.
It was so much fun watching our Chef prepare the food right at our table on the cooking surface. And there was so much wonderful food, from soup to salad to veggies and noodles. And that was in addition to the main course.
Dessert? No way, I was stuffed.
Will I get back again? You but I will!!

data.title: Decent, but not Japanese
data.text: I ordered a shrimp pad-thai.  It was good, portions were huge.  This actually was two meals for me.  At first I thought the prices were high but I guess if you consider that each meal is really two meals, it's ok.  Not a good place if you are trying to lose weight and tend to overeat!  The service was good.  Don't be fooled by the name, it's not Japanese although they had some sushi and such on the menu.  I tend to only buy Japanese food when I'm at a real Japanese restaurant.  The restaurant is rather dark.  The food was fairly good but not outstanding.  They were generous with the shrimp.

data.title: Average at best
data.text: I would say way overrated. Average at best. Not the friendliest people in the world. If you're looking for an average meal this is your place. Nothing fancy nothing over-the-top

data.title: Solid Asian
data.text: Kind of something for everyone, Asian. The restaurant has sushi, tempura, hibachi, stir-fry and Thai. I had a refreshing and spicy chopped tuna wrapped in lettuce and rich paper followed by an appetizer sized drunken noodles.

data.title: Great Hibachi and really fun!
data.text: This is another well established restaurant in Weston. It has a huge menu and also about 6 or 8 hibachi tables. A fun place to go or to celebrate a birthday. My kids always love it. They put on a good show.

data.title: Really enjoyable evening
data.text:
We arrived an hour early for our table reservation to sit at the bar and have a couple of martini's during happy hour.
Taken to our table together with our two friends and two locals and waited for our chef Santos to perform his skills and come up with some good food.  Lots of fun at the table and the food was excellent, even better when we found out that staying at Weston Vacation Village gave us 10% of the meal - Result

data.title: Japan Inn quality dropping
data.text:
We loved this place! Used to go here once a month for special occasions, but week was a bust!!!

We had reservations for a party of 7 and 2 of our party showed up 10 minutes late.You should have seen the looks we were getting from staff. So we sat down with 2 other people ( not from our party) waiting for us at the teppen table. Wow did we get looks from them. The waitress shows up not even 20 seconds from our arriving demanding we get our orders placed. Well I'm sorry but my mom was taking me out for a belated fathers day and she's 88 years old. Give us a break. 

When we ordered our food we tried to communicate to the waitress what we wanted and after 4 attempts we thought we had it right. Nope. in the past they have always served both noodles and rice, or noodles no rice, or no noodles and rice. Some in my family eat rice some eat noodles. Not this time. The waitress said "both noodles and rice, we no splitting orders". Then we explained one family member has shrimp allergy and the shrimp need to be cooked separately. You would think they have never done that before, when in fact they have always done it for us before. The chef got so pissed he never did any of the artistic cooking and in fact didn't talk to any of us all night. The chicken was dry, the steak was severely over cooked. And the noodles had some kind of spice in it that made it inedible.
We tried to complain but manager (female) said "Oh? So sorry" come back. 
Since we have always like it in the past we will go back and give them another chance, but only one more chance. I don't gamble specially with the price of food now a days. Price for dinner for 7 guests with no appetizers and 1 beer without tip was $$228

data.title: Food and Entertainment
data.text: We had reservation for 8pm and we did not get seated until way after 9 pm. The grandchildren love this place for the entertainment. The food was plenty and  good but  too much soy sauce. We took half a portion  home  but we could not eat it the next day  The added soy sauce  turn sour the  day after.

data.title: More food for your money
data.text: Awesome atmosphere, friendly staff.   The food is exceptional.  You get so much for your money.  The drinks are great as well.  The bartender has been working there for years and he is one of the best bartenders around.  The chef's are fun and interact with guest.  Perfect for any occasion.

data.title: Quick service
data.text: very friendly and the food was great. The servers were extreme fast and very cordual. I will return for dinner.

data.title: Best in Town!!
data.text: I love this Japan Inn (Weston location). Food is fresh and very affordable. The menu has a big selection from sushi entrees to hibachi plates. I love coming here for the lunch special and of course the hibachi is delicious! Place is clean and has friendly staff.

data.title: One of my favorite local spots to dine
data.text: Always busy so make a reservation if there are more than 4 in your party during dinnertime. Great food and service.  Hibachi is always popular but you can sit at a regular table or outside in the spacious patio. Everything is delicious. I often get vegetable hibachi and go home with so much food for home.

data.title: Best thing in Weston Town Centre
data.text: Definitely a highlight. You can have the show for dinner or outside lunch. We've done both, and the food is excellent at a fabulous price.

data.title: Good Japanese option
data.text: Japan Inn is a good option in Weston for great hibachi, good sushi. Well located in Town Center with ample room and cooking tables

data.title: Nice Dining Experience
data.text: The food is very tasty and the sauces are great. Of course you will go for the show which is always fun but you will enjoy the food as well. They have a little appetizer which is like Crab Rangoon but better. It is a smaller place so get there early but they do have seating outside if you aren't especially there for the show. Service is good as the food is cooked in front of you
